Summary Responsibilities 
Management of Yahoo’s highest-valued client relationships for the Technology & Telecommunications vertical. Leading a 25 person team responsible for driving and servicing over $500MM in total annual online ad sales revenue. Primary focus on Search and Display advertising products including Mobile, Native, Video, and Social businesses. Understanding client business objectives and goals to drive superior account efficiencies and ROI performance. Developing revenue strategies, account plans, and business processes to identify client sales and service opportunities. Hiring, coaching, and mentoring Account Managers to drive engagement by supporting personal and professional development. Establishing strong partnerships with Product, Marketing, Training, and Engineering teams to drive customer needs 
 
Achievements 
Delivered over 15% annual sales growth for my online advertising business since becoming a Manager. Achieved 100% scores for every individual or team performance goal such as product adoption quarterly. Consistently in the top 10% for all leadership and effectiveness scores in Yahoo’s Employee Engagement Survey annually. Elevated over 50% of the Account Managers on my team into leadership positions within 3 years 
 
Awards 
Recipient of the 2014 Excellence Award honoring the top 10% at Yahoo based on the average of Q1-Q4 performance ratings. Received multiple Superstar nominations for the past 5 consecutive years, Yahoo’s highest form of peer-nominated recognition. Repeated Winner’s Circle recipient as Yahoo’s top 5% Sales and Account Managers selected by Senior Leadership  
 
Extracurricular 
Submitted a CEO challenge and received the executive green light for a project to help save Yahoo over $10MM annually. Orchestrated a nationwide innovation initiative called Y!dealab to drive grassroots approach to solving common problems. Volunteer for Yahoo’s Employee Foundation by successfully obtaining grants to help fund local animal shelter, PAWS Summary Responsibilities

Summary Cada compañía es un mundo distinto. Llenarse con la cultura que cada una de ellas aporta y poder reconocer la diversidad existente de las mismas me ha dado la capacidad de ver un poco más allá. Observar a la empresa, sus empleados y todos sus públicos como un todo, me ha permitido comprender de manera objetiva sus fortalezas, debilidades, amenazas, ventajas, y por sobre todo las oportunidades, que eventualmente tomaré y desarrollaré en el rol que desempeñe.
